Variables¶

Variables are used to exchange status information of elements between plugins. They are used in the Trigger and Expression Listener plugins. The foundation is built by the Variables API.

Most plugins using the API do some preprocessing. These “conventions” are described here. The variable system is explained in Variables, please read it first.

We distinguish between preprocessed variables, keys and expressions.

Preprocessed Variables¶

Variable names are used to initialize a variable. It contains only the name of the variable without group/stack values. Most plugins preprocess the variable names using the Selectors API to provide generic names. Please read Selectors for available keywords.

Preprocessed Keys¶

Preprocessed keys are a comma-seperated list of keys as described in Variables. Each key is preprocessed using Selectors.

Preprocessed Expressions¶

These are expressions as described in Variables plus preprocessing unsing Selectors.

Initialisation¶

The initialisation is done with a preprocessed variable name, an initial value (which is also preprocessed) and a variable type, which can be simple, group or stack. In case of a simple varaible, this has to be true or false.

For more information read the documentationof the Variables API.

JavaScript¶

Plugins.fn.variable_init(variable, value, type)¶

Adds an offset element to the top to the current context.

Arguments:
  • variable (string) – Preprocessed variable name.
  • value (string) – Preprocessed value.
  • type (string) – Data type, "simple", "group" or "stack".
Returns:

An object providing enable and disable functions.
